title: How to Save Images or Videos from Text Messages on iPhone

steps.title: Open the Messages app.
steps.content: Open the Messages app. Its icon is green and contains a white speech bubble.

steps.title: Open a conversation.
steps.content: Open a conversation. Select the conversation between you and a contact that contains photos you want to save to your phone.

steps.title: Tap and hold the image you want to save.
steps.content: Tap and hold the image you want to save. You will have the option to select “Copy,” “Save,” or “More…”

steps.title: Tap Save.
steps.content: Tap Save . The image will save to your phone and you can view the image in your Photos app.

steps.title: Open the Messages app.
steps.content: Open the Messages app. Its icon is green and contains a white speech bubble.

steps.title: Open a conversation.
steps.content: Open a conversation. Select the threaded conversation that has photos you want to save to your phone.

steps.title: Tap the information icon.
steps.content: Tap the information icon. It’s in the upper right corner of your screen.

steps.title: Scroll to the bottom of the page.
steps.content: Scroll to the bottom of the page. You will see all of the images and attachments sent between you and that contact.

steps.title: Hold your finger down on an image or attachment.
steps.content: Hold your finger down on an image or attachment. You will have the option to choose “Copy,” “Delete,” or “More…”

steps.title: Tap More.
steps.content: Tap More . You will now be able to select the images.

steps.title: Tap the images you want to save.
steps.content: Tap the images you want to save. A blue checkmark will appear in the bottom right corner of the selected images.

steps.title: Tap Save Images.
steps.content: Tap Save Images . The selected images will save to your phone. You can view them in your Photos app.
